intro: Pimpinella chungdienensis, commonly known as the Chungdien cowpea, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and has pinnately compound leaves. Its small white or yellow flowers are followed by spherical fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
